website_summaries.verdict: Excellent audio quality at a reasonable price point for hardware that will fit on a bookshelf.
pros: 2-piece speaker system to provide a nice level of audio quality
Uses a 5.12-inch woofer that delivers better results with low end frequencies
Speaker's physical design specifically made to avoid audio distortion
Speakers are short enough that they'll fit almost anywhere
cons: Amp may not deliver enough power for the tastes of some listeners

customer_reviews.title: Can rival hi-end
customer_reviews.text: If anything, the Wide-Dispersion Super Tweeter does exactly as described, adding an incredible sense of space and enhancing detail. It pinpoints every subtle detail within the huge soundstage, and the listener becomes a part of it. Great voice presence in the right recordings. I carefully treat the butyl black surrounds with ArmorAll or Nova leather and vinyl cleaner, using a Q-tip. This prevents deterioration and keeps them like new for decades, in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: chinpoko

customer_reviews.title: Good Value with Great Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: Clean, crisp with enough bass for my taste. Tied with a Yamaha RX-483 receiver a Micca MB42X-C center channel speaker and Energy sub.. I now have the perfect mongrel combination for our condo living area. The sub is kept at minimum levels in consideration of our neighbors. The Micca is great as the center speaker and adds a great dimension of quality sound for under $70. I first looked at much more expensive speakers but kept coming back to the Sony's because of the price to review rating performance and their size. They are well engineered and at $118 for the pair a really good deal.
customer_reviews.author: RRHeerens

customer_reviews.title: Worthy bookshelf speakers
customer_reviews.text: I use these bookshelves for a 2.1 setup on my Dell desktop! I have the speakers connected to a mini amp with a clean 20 watts per channel that gives you a nice soundstage as well as being loud! You could go without a sub depending on your musical taste, but I opted for a 10” sub to round out the low end for rap and reggae music! The difference between powered bookshelves or 2.1 satellites is like night and day! I’ll never go back to Logitech-type speakers or powered speakers!
customer_reviews.author: Papa Javo

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Color me surprised!
customer_reviews.text: At first a bit strange. Swapped over to my XTZ amp and they really started to sing. Not the best I've heard but AMAZING for the price. Wide soundstage. Great vocal clarity. Added in Elac sub X'd at about 100hz. And they sound even bigger and better. You give these good source and power, they can be really good. They do get a bit overwhelmed with heavy, busy metal or large orchestral at loud volumes. 100% expected for asoeaker this size. Keep the volume at reasonable levels, and they are good to go. Did I mention wide open soundstage!!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce B

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers.
customer_reviews.text: I was leery at first before ordering, after all, a perfect 5 star rating with hundreds of reviewers? Sounded fishy. But I was pleasantly surprised. These speakers are truly outstanding. Close your eyes and you wouldn’t believe the sound was coming out of $100 dollar speakers. Smooth bass and mids and crystal clear upper range. Of course the woofers won’t rattle the walls, but the overall sound quality is balanced and suitable for most musical genres. If you need speakers, especially in this price range, these are as close to perfect as you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Flan

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a part of my summer house audio system. They spent a winter in a frozen living room of an uninhabited house. Just a few days ago I was there to move my old Denon AVR1713 receiver and tested these. First 10 minutes speakers needed a bit of time to warm up. After that all the highs, mids and lows were there. I was planning to purchases a separate subwoofer for the set, considered that woofer is just 5 1/4". I don't think I'll invest in subwoofer now, as bass is pretty good either. It actually sounds not less great as a pair of KEF bookshelves!
customer_reviews.author: Giorgi

customer_reviews.title: The sound is really so so
customer_reviews.text: I have a few pairs bookshelf speakers at home including Elac B5, Kef coda7, Sony SS-B1000 and this pair. I like the other 3 pairs in different way, I also wanted to like this Sony sscs5, but I could not because Sony sscs5 sound is somewhat muffled and lack of life. To me, Sony sscs5 can't even compare to the older and cheaper version Sony SS-B1000 (that's a great model, especially at that price level, btw) . Look elsewhere if you want a pair of speakers with nice sound.
customer_reviews.author: SG333

customer_reviews.title: Sound way better than what you pay for them.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike, people on here that say they don’t sound good are smoking krack. You need power to drive these, and when you give them the power they ask for they pay you back 10 fold. I have some Cerwin Vega bookshelf speakers and I lu uh uh uve them. These Sony’s hang right there with them. No, these bookshelf speakers are not $700-$1000, but $120 there is nothing to complain about. But they need some power, not advertised power, legitimate power. I don’t mean 1000 watts, but a true genuine 65+ Watts from a clean receiver or amp will drive them cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Nunya

customer_reviews.title: Guess I got a bad one?
customer_reviews.text: One of the speakers had a tin vibrating sound from the moment I turned it on. I switched channels on the receiver, I even bought better speaker wire.. I read sometimes they need to be broken in so I played some music at half level for a week... Never got better. I returned these to Amazon. One is defective (I marked it with a note on it for you guys to look over)
customer_reviews.author: DeluXXXe

customer_reviews.title: Tiny size, big sound.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and compact. They're like a third of the size of the set that shipped with my old Sony LBT-D390, but still pump out the jams. That set also had the "super tweeter", so these were a perfect replacement. The 50kHz upper range is insane, but makes a difference. High frequencies are clear, even in another room. Certainly helps counter the absorption of the higher frequencies in a typical furnished room. The woofers are a little weak on the low end, but they're certainly helped by the rear bass port. Placing them in a bookshelf or corner is a good idea. Pairing them with the SA-CS9 subwoofer is perfect to balance the excellent highs with thundering lows.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Quality Bookshelf Replacement Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality replacement to similar JBL speakers on 35 Watt Kenwood Receiver. Excellent dynamic range, great bass response, well balanced tonal quality. Seems to sound better than many high-end/more expensive speakers (Altec, Klipsch EV, etc.) I've heard throughout many years of being somewhat of an audiophile.
customer_reviews.author: SweenDog1

customer_reviews.title: I got a lot more than I thought! And even after I read the good reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is the one pair that you will not be able to criticize if you have a decent amp to output the sound from. I am using a modern digital amp of only 80w for 4 to 8 ohms. And adding those speakers to it is making all my gear sound fantastic. I use the speakers to mainly mix music. Yes, I prefer an amp and those non-powered speakers. (personal choice!) Leaving the amp to its neutral tone setting, I am able to work with those speakers who are faithfully giving what the mix is supposed to give. Trust in your musical equipment is paramount. And those are doing their part. I recommend those speakers wholeheartedly.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Collignon

customer_reviews.title: Serious Distortion
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sounded extremely distorted to such an extend that I thought my stereo components were malfunctioning. These speakers buzzed and blared. I have since replaced them with Polk Audio speakers and everything sounds great a gain. It seems they might have been defective, but certainly did not live up to all the ratings I read. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive speakers.
customer_reviews.text: I got the Sony SS CS5 bookshelf speakers during the sale for half of the regular price. Hook them up with the inexpensive tube amp. I cast music from Spotify or my Plex server to the system through Google Chrome Cast music . With this setup, listening to music is a very joyable experience, good lively sound quality without breaking my bank.
customer_reviews.author: J.N.L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bookshelf speakers, even compared to the much higher priced premium speakers
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that I enjoy listening to music and instrumental sound from a very early age. My ears are very perceptible to the high frequency sounds. I was in the market to get a high resolution speaker that excels on the high frequency notes. And boy, do these speakers deliver, with its 3 driver super tweeter configuration. I am finally happy with my setup. Here is my home audio setup: 1. Onkyo TX-8220 2.0 stereo receiver/amp w/ BT. 2. Sony SSCS5 3-Way bookshelf speakers 3. Dayton Audio subwoofer. I also own a pair of Micca MB42X bookshelf speakers, but the Miccas don't hold a candle to the sound clarity of these Sony SSCS5s.
customer_reviews.author: Sayan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bookshelf Speakers!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these on Prime Day to use as garage speakers. They have a nice full range and realistic sounding, well defined bass response. I brought them in the house and compared them to my Polk Signature S15's which I use as main speakers in my home theater system. The Sony's compared favorably in overall sound response.
customer_reviews.author: Chaubo

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I paired these with a Sony STRDH590 5.2 multi-channel 4k HDR AV Receiver and a Polk Audio PSW10 10" Powered Subwoofer and they sound great! Very happy with my purchase. Even without the extra Polk Subwoofer these had nice bass, I just needed more.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Love these speakers!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to listen to music in my home office and loved them so much that I moved them to the living room to replace the Sony SS-B1000 speakers in my home theater system. I moved the SS-B1000's into my office and after a couple of months, I decided just to go ahead and buy a second pair of these SSCS5's since they sound so much clearer. The bass response is a little better than SS-B1000, but the high end is especially crisp.
customer_reviews.author: Brad D.

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING WHEN ON SALE
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this set of speakers at a great price. The strange thing is the price jumps around all the time. I went to check the price a few days later and the speakers were nearly $100 more! Then, a week or two later, I checked again, and they were back in the $80 range where they make a great value. Build quality and design are beautiful and the sound is very good, at least for these older ears. But I don't need 100 watts of power, that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Behmer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Buy - Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: I did some reading online, and the best sound quality comes from wired speakers. I added these speakers to a bluetooth receiver and man they crank out music nice and clear with no distortion that I can hear (I think that I am pushing about 80 watts). There is a lot of junk for sale out there at Best Buy and other retailers (who no longer carry these speakers). However, these speakers, which I recently purchased for $75, are worth every penny and more.
customer_reviews.author: M. F. Koeppen

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are great little speakers. I replaced a set of full sized speakers in my den with these to gain back some space. For me these Sony speakers sound better than the big ones they replaced. Amazing clarity for such small speakers. No, the bass won't shake the furniture, but I'm many years past where I thought that was important. Can I hear all the individual instruments with these - Yes! Nearly reference quality.
customer_reviews.author: JimW

customer_reviews.title: Buy them I don’t think you’ll be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was like I can’t believe all the excellent reviews these speakers are getting. I have an old Yamaha receiver that I hooked them up to and added a Bluetooth receiver to the mix. Wow what sound from bookshelf speakers. The sound is smooth and you can really crank them. If you want some bass heavy music add a sub. My receiver doesn’t have a sub out connection so I can’t. That said I don’t really need one as these speakers exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: kaz

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck speakers
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value for the Money! These little speakers are surprisingly good. These are the cheapest speakers I have so was not expecting much, just bought them based on recommendations form a friend and the Amazon sale. Pleasantly surprised! Perfect for a den or bedroom system, good tone and overall sound. Easy to drive, and relatively small. They would also be great to start a budget home theater with, I think there is a matching center channel.
customer_reviews.author: J Walker

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Speaker
customer_reviews.text: Very nice sounding speaker. Well worth the money. I don't normally go with Sony, but with all of the five star reviews I thought I'd go ahead and try a pair. They match up perfectly with a pair of JBL A20's. Couldn't decide which of the two I liked better. If you need a bookshelf speaker at a decent price, these are the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Danny C

customer_reviews.title: Great for HI-REZ
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a Class AD Vacuum tube 50 watt Amp with Bluetooth...I stream DSP FLAC over Bluetooth 5.0 with Sony Hi-Rez media player.. The speakers are Hi Efficient with a 90db rating a 1m and the super tweeter catches the high freaks... Very nice inexpensive speakers for this.. There Just GREAT speakers for the money...
customer_reviews.author: A Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Hifi 100%
customer_reviews.text: First thing: Great bass response for speakers this size. Med and high frecuencies really good too. For those who like to listen music to thw minimum details this is it...for the price. First music I played was Steely Dan and they sounded excellent. Then I added a botle of red and it felt like heaven.
customer_reviews.author: JC3289

customer_reviews.title: Sony SSC55 bookshelf speaker.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how well these speakers sound. I own Elac B6 debut 2's and Klipsch RP600's so I have something to compare the Sony's to. The lil sony's sound better at lower volume then the other two I mentioned. Really good for the price. I got them on sell for half price, however at $148 dollars regular price these are a great deal compared to the price of the elac's and the klipsch.
customer_reviews.author: mark c.

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: After having these for almost a year, using in a space about 225 sq ft, ... I am hard pressed to spend any more money on anything else. I want to, ...but i just don't know "how much" better sound I could get for spending $100's more. Using with Fosi Audio DAC for BT, Audio Technica LP120X, and driven by YAQIN MC-13S.
customer_reviews.author: gr3atwhit3

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mid and high frequency coverage.
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly crisp high frequency, very good mid range with enough punch alone, needs to pair with a sub woofer for full high fidelity but can stand alone no problem as well. Solid construction you can tell simply by the weight to be honest. Each tweeter/speaker has its own driver so none are trying to play a tone it is not great at they all have their own job to do which is how you want it. I use it in a factory... Big space and it performs like a concert nearby so small spaces it will be overkill which I consider underrated.
customer_reviews.author: matthew winegar

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality speakers.
customer_reviews.text: What did we like or dislike is the question, well, nothing is to dislike about these beautiful little speakers. What a rich and full sound is produced by with the help from our Denon AVR-1000. We also purchased from Amazon a 1Mii B06 Plus Bluetooth Receiver, HIFI Wireless Audio Adapter, Bluetooth 4.2 Receiver with 3D Surround aptX Low Latency for Home Music Streaming Stereo System (Upgraded With Power Adapter). No static or interference. My wife and I agree what a great purchase for the quality and inexpensiveness you receive from this product that is working so well for our application of these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: WJ

customer_reviews.title: Bargain Sony speakers great for entry level system
customer_reviews.text: Well built with good sound quality.bdoesnt blow you away but for the price you can't find better. Could handle bass a little better but it's still decent. If you want a solid entry level HiFi system at a good price, take a look at these
customer_reviews.author: Logan Stearns

customer_reviews.title: decent speakers but no grill
customer_reviews.text: I got my pair of speakers and they seem to function well. The sound is decent. However, one speaker came with the cloth front grill, and other did not. Fortunately, I have the speakers where they are not easily seen. This is disappointing. I doubt this issue is related to Sony, but the retailer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased. I bought these to possibly replace my Behringer ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased. I bought these to possibly replace my Behringer 2030P Studio Reference monitors. I'll find some other use for the Behringers. They took only about 4 hours to overcome some initial harshness out of the box. Very smooth now and getting better. Worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Clawhand Luke

customer_reviews.title: WELL worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up for 75 on sale and running with an older Pioneer amplifier. These put out an extraordinary amount of sound at exceptionally clear levels, even at high volumes. The audio is clear and concise with rich bass on these that well outperforms the small size of the speakers. These have become my staple for house parties.
customer_reviews.author: Austin S

customer_reviews.title: great sound great value
customer_reviews.text: I hooked these up to my Denon 5800 AVR. Great reproduction and range with minimal roll of. Clean sound. No distortion. I put a sine generator thru the amps and speakers and then captured same with my MKH 800 P48 feeding an o-Scope, honest reproduction of waveform from hi to low. I was completely surmised at how well these speakers perform. Well Done Sony
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bookshelf speakers for general music enjoyment
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of these same bookshelf speakers. They're simply the best bookshelves you'll find in this price range -- especially at their quarterly sale price, which is about half their list price. They're obviously not the Focal monitors I have in my studio, or the $4k BW towers in my media room -- these are well suited for just jamming out in an office, garage, workshop, family room, etc.
customer_reviews.author: argiope

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are great. I bought them for my apartment and they sound amazing. Though they work well for a medium sized apartment, they would also work well in large spaces or outside too. For the comments about a sub woofer, these speakers definitely have great sounding bass, and you don't need a sub woofer.
customer_reviews.author: Therealbreezy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, a little flat, needs subwoofer added
customer_reviews.text: These sound and look nice. I haven’t really had a chance yet to crank em up all the way and see what they can really handle because I need to get a nice subwoofer. Currently without the subwoofer they are a little flat sounding but I think I’ll be good once I get everything together. One vibrated off the shelf and hit the floor. It took the drop well. No damage that I’m aware of. Big stars for that.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Lyons

customer_reviews.title: 2nd pair purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sounding new speaker (for the money) that I have heard. I have a total of 5 Sony SSCS5 3 way Bookshelves (one being used as the Center speaker) along with a pair of JBL Arena Venue Series (as Mains) in a 5.2.2 ATMOS sound system. I am a professional musician and I have heard nearly all speakers of all types and brands. From Home to Studio Monitors to Stage and Live Sound. IF YOU CAN GET THESE WHEN THEY ARE ON SALE... there is nothing better. Very nice FLAT tonal response (No funky muddy Mids or Bass) with beautiful highs, great cymbals... They match up with my JBL's very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: JustSomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Surprised! Blew my socks off!
customer_reviews.text: These are some great bookshelf speakers. Perhaps the best I’ve ever had, and the price can’t be beat. So glad I went with these instead of something more expensive. I’m no audiophile but they sound great to me. Fill my large living room with sound.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick F.

customer_reviews.title: Great set of speakers!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality speakers that feel well constructed and sound amazing for this price. I just listened to these and a pair of MartinLogan bookshelf that were $599 for the pair. Being pushed by the same receiver, for what i wanted, these sounded better!
customer_reviews.author: ballouskys

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Extremely satisfied. I was initially planning to spend $500 plus on new bookshelf speakers. Spent $118 on these. Unbelievable for the price. Would probably need to spend $1000 for a real upgrade above these. I primarily listen to jazz and other forms of acoustic music. The level of detail provided is exceptional for the price. If you're hesitant to spend a ton of money on audiophile speakers look no further - these SONY speakers are just so good for what you spend. Congrats Sony on making an affordable, exceptional product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous, rich sound.
customer_reviews.text: Being these are 100 watt speakers, I’m powering them with a 100 watt stereo system (please see pic), and these speakers grab all of the highs, midrange, and lovely lows right out. I love these speakers. Full stop.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Great main speakers IMO
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile, I have this hooked to a 2 channel old 100 watt receiver with a 100 watt 8", down-firing sub in my small living room with my TV and record player. They sound very, very good. No distortion up to the point where I'm worried about bothering my neighbors. Bass is good, I got the sub for movies and gaming. The highs on these speakers are very clear and the overall tone is great in both quiet passages and when rocking out. I got these for ~$70 bucks and that was a steal. For over ~120 maybe I'd shop around. Maybe.
customer_reviews.author: GEOFF STUART

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the price with a small caveat
customer_reviews.text: These speakers fill up my medium size room but the sound seems to lack texture. They have bass, the vocals are centered and about 3 feet in front of the speakers, but they sound thin because they don't have enough meat in lower vocals. For the price, they are a huge bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: Completes a 5.1 setup
customer_reviews.text: Love them. Have them on stands as my rear speakers in my 5.1 setup. Hearing sounds in movies now that I never heard before. Constantly turning my head looking for where some sounds are coming from then realize it's in the movie.
customer_reviews.author: AdamAnt

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price a great set of bookshelf speakers. Currently have hooked up to my amp for my LP player. I will probably add some tower speakers for louder play, but for a smaller room works great.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J Castonguay

customer_reviews.title: So crisp.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are so clean and crisp. They get good and loud but they're not gonna shake your house down, but you shouldn't expect them to. They are lacking a little bit in the bass, but paired with a good sub, these are absolutely incredible for their price
customer_reviews.author: Luc L

customer_reviews.title: Very good sounding speakers and for the sale price very hard ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good sounding speakers and for the sale price very hard to beat. Get 4 of these and a center speaker and you have an inexpensive start to a nice home theater system.
customer_reviews.author: Afro GT

customer_reviews.title: Good Speakers at Good Price.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good. Got two sets plus a center speaker (SSCS8) and a subwoofer (SACS9) - all connected to the Sony 1070DN receiver. All together produce really good sound and enough bass to fill the living room (about 17ft x 17ft).
customer_reviews.author: Clin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing clarity, great value
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing in the upper range but lack bass. What bass they do make sounds good, they just dont put out enough. Luckily I have them paired with Bose 301s that have 8 inch woofers but lack in high range clarity. The two of them combined sounds like really expensive tower speakers. If you dont want to buy 301s, an extra subwoofer would be a good call. Wait for these to be on sale, they are often sold for $70 for the pair which is just a stupid good value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My house rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a sound guy with pro gear since 1975. These speakers are fantastic. Sound and build, the best I've seen at this price point, I use them with a Klipsch 10 subwoofer and my house rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Taiji on Maui

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, these speakers are amazing. The sound is full, rich, all the mids and highs with excellent bass as well. I really couldn't be happier with them. I'm sure its possible to spend much more money for a shelf speaker, but it would be hard to beat the sound of these in any price range. They sound like a much larger speaker. They are beautiful to look at too. They sure sit pretty with my vintage Sony Scenario system while rocking the house. If your looking for speakers, don't hesitate, these are the ones. And the price...nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Glassburn

customer_reviews.title: They look great and they sound even better!
customer_reviews.text: A pair of Sony 3-way speakers for less than $75 That's incredible and they work perfect for my surround sound rear speakers. They look great and they sound amazing. I am extremely happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: cs.cooper

customer_reviews.title: 3 way Sony what can I say
customer_reviews.text: I needed something kinda small with a big sound..These speakers were a gift for someone in need..they have a very nice look to them, to match the sound expectatios..I wasn't disappointed on performance or looks..and the set was well received..as expected..is a Sony..(3 Way Passive with a tuned port) Mave
customer_reviews.author: Mave

customer_reviews.title: Lack bass
customer_reviews.text: You definitely gonna need Sub-Woofer for this. If you connect all the speaker in SONY speaker system with woofer and all you will be fine, but by itself wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Narayan Acharya

customer_reviews.title: Long time Sony buyer
customer_reviews.text: I have owed many Sony products. These speakers sound absolutely amazing. Clean, clear, and have plenty of depth. The highs are high. The mids are clear. The bass punches. Good quality, and they're not expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S. Long

customer_reviews.title: Great Speaker
customer_reviews.text: These are great speakers as far as range, crispness, and volume. For the money, these are actually incredible. They are shipped in a padded secure box and they look great too.
customer_reviews.author: David Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Good performance for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers for use on my old Sony receiver after I added a theater receiver to to our large family room area. I added an Alexa input to the old receiver and started enjoying the music. I was pleasantly surprised by the bass produced and the full range of music reproduction. I recommend these for excellent listening and compact size. A good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: More than a bargain, they add smiles that will crack your face!
customer_reviews.text: My only problem was I didn't buy these before now. Listening to a good set of speakers for about a year, I thought I should try something else. Do this, don't do what I did, but these and be done with it. They are that nice! Bob
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Most excellent when paired with a subwoof!
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is excellent, at least for above subwoof-level signals. Pair it with a nice subwoof (Sony makes some good ones), it is space-efficient and sounds perfect. I'm no audio-snob, but can appreciate good sound at a great value :)
customer_reviews.author: Julian R.

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding for not a lot of money
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding for not a lot of money. Replaced my well-worn Sony towers with these bookshelf one. Solid base and clear mids and high ranges make these perfect for a surround systems. Some may want a sub, but for a smaller space these Sony bookshelf speakers do a great job providing some thumps. Very happy with the purchase. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding for the money
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the better sounding pair of passive speakers I've tried under $300 or so range. Clear sound, balanced tone in general, vibrant mids, and clear highs. Lacks in the low/bass but that's to be expected from the size of the speakers. I'd recommend pairing it with a decent sub if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Sahab Mas

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These are great little speakers, and the cost was the same as most 2 way speakers. I retired my Lafayette 2002 huge speakers from the 70's
customer_reviews.author: R. FRANK

customer_reviews.title: Great Sounding sony Budget Speakers!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone who hears these small Sony bookshelf speakers compliments me on how good they sound! I am very pleased with the sound that comes out of such a small package! Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... pair make my "antique" Sony component stereo sound much better! They take up less space & deserve a ...
customer_reviews.text: The pair make my "antique" Sony component stereo sound much better! They take up less space & deserve a seven star rating! Thanx!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect center Piece for my sony dolby atmos sound
customer_reviews.text: Bang for the buck is what I call it, and this speaker with my other sony speakers in this series have a nice symbiotic relationship, couple this with my transducer and dreamscreen back lighting, I have a nice little viewing and video game experience, that is much more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald L.

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how good these speakers sound. When I purchased them, my thoughts were, “eh a little over 100 bucks and great reviews they’re probably ok.” Boy was I wrong I have spent some money on speakers before to say the least, and these compare to most speakers in the $500 Plus range. I have been pleasantly surprised! That being said I would recomend removing the screens from them. The screens are made cheaply and damper the base response. That’s the only bad thing I can say about them, and for 100 bucks, who cares?
customer_reviews.author: daniel cline

customer_reviews.title: Got sound for a small to medium room
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my son. To use in bedroom. He loves them but wished they had a little more base. Sound is ok. Not ear shattering but enjoyable.We paired them with a sony amplifier that was recommend for them.
customer_reviews.author: Digital_Hate

customer_reviews.title: Great Clear Sound, Affordable, Recommended
customer_reviews.text: These Sony bookcase size speakers provide excellent sound quality at a great price. Easy to hook up - just strip the leads of the stereo wires and screw it in to the two posts on each speaker. They are heavier than I imagined, but pack a clear, room filling sound. Good for 6 or 8 ohms- I’m running 6 ohms with my Sony receiver. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia K. Cox

customer_reviews.title: for the price these sound amazing.
customer_reviews.text: sony really hit it out of the park with this per of speakers. sound is great. i use these for left and right speakers. for my 7.1 speaker set up. i paid $74 for the pair. very happy. i strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: s.

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality, amazing sound, and affordable. Can keep up with high end products
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely stunned at the sound these speakers can produce. I definitely have a good ear for sound and these speakers have an amazing sound stage for the price point. I have them as left/right surrounds in a 5.1 system with a mostly Klipsch Reference Series system. They match up perfectly brightness wise and can definitely keep up with the klipsch bookshelves. Lastly, the build quality impressed me for only paying $73 for the pair. They certainly have some weight to them and are great looking too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They sound great
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality from these is pretty good considering the price I paid for them on sale. I have them hooked up in a di-amp setup and they provided a much needed improvement to my soundscape.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate sound with no noticeable distortion. Used for a desk environment and the sound is very clear and detailed, though the bass is not boomy, it is definitely sufficient. They feel very high quality as well and can compliment any setup.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Arciniega

customer_reviews.title: Sound decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: They are alright. But I miss the oldtime speakers with some size. Don't anyone make 8 and 10 inch speakers anymore?
customer_reviews.author: Larry Banks

customer_reviews.title: Sony? Really? That good? Wow!
customer_reviews.text: So yeah, these are really damn good, got them for 73 dollars on sale. Crisp warm and not overly sharp, but very well defined high end, and way more bass than you would expect for a bookshelf speaker. I love how Sony tunes their speakers, very warm middle of the road momma bear balancing. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: spicyramenTT

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent speakers, eq tweeking as well as placement will allow you to get the best sound out of these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: C.joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: These make excellent bookshelf speakers. Very impressed with the quality and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: P. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great
customer_reviews.text: Sounds way better than the price. Good highs, miss and decent bass for the small sized woofer.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Henry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. The sound is just 10/10
customer_reviews.text: Holy....This good for $120??? Sony has made quite a name for itself, and this speaker proves its no sham. No matter what I listen to, everything sounds amazing, maybe even Justin Bieber, wow... I mean I'm a heavy metal guy, whatever. FYI, you need a AMP to use these, I highly recommend SMSL Q5 Pro.
customer_reviews.author: narek

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound. I’ve bought three sets of these for my house. They are affordable and sounds great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker, tight and clear sound.
customer_reviews.text: After listening to over a dozen speakers, some costing 3 times as much, I went with these Sony's and a Sony sub woofer. These provide a very tight sound with clear highs, mids, and tight bass, Just what I was looking for. I use these in my rec room/billiards room and listen to all types of music.
customer_reviews.author: straydog

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speakers
customer_reviews.text: I have these speakers paired with a Yamaha R-S202BL receiver and a Fluance RT81 turntable and couldn't be happier. They have the perfect amount of bass and crystal clear treble.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality and sound......without being too large or too heavy or too expensive. Sony seems to know what they're doing when it comes to audio.
customer_reviews.author: TomC

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Clear, precise and powerful bookshelf speakers. These are not powered, but need to be connected to an amplifier or tuner. The sound, even at very high volume is outstanding!
customer_reviews.author: KRR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bargain !
customer_reviews.text: I finally got over home theater but missed my music. Did a lot of research and these speakers keep coming up positive. I paired them with a new Yamaha 2 channel receiver and wow ! Good bass, very clear sound, couldn't be happier for the price and performance of both. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson Mcduffie

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding
customer_reviews.text: The speakers sound good paired with a denon receiver. Reviews I found on the net while looking for a bookshelf were dead on as these sound excellent, comparable to my monitor audio bronze which I bought at 2x the price.
customer_reviews.author: DuffyDoc

customer_reviews.title: Man... these are clear
customer_reviews.text: Man... these are so nice. So clear. Have them running through Fosi tube pre amp and Fosi 100w amp along side a polk subwoofer. I would recommend them 100%
customer_reviews.author: JB.Scorpio

customer_reviews.title: The best bang for your buck...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on sale for $73.00 a pair. These beauties really do the trick. Why waste your money on more expensive rip-offs? Wait until they go on sale again, like I did.
customer_reviews.author: BlackGoldMustang

customer_reviews.title: Sony is the best
customer_reviews.text: You will finally hear all the words you have been missing on TV. Excellent center speaker. Very clear. Great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Best passive pair of studio monitors very clear. The bass is accurate and the treble is a little high but can be tamed with a good EQ.
customer_reviews.author: Chad S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Speakers at a Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I had was the size of the speakers. I thought I had bought speakers that were larger , apparently I did not. The smaller ones do what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Ken G.

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, clean sound. Nice overall for size.
customer_reviews.text: I used these speakers fortify my fronts in my surround sound. I wanted more mid and top end sound and so far I'm very pleased. I only wished I bought them sooner before the price went up. They would have been a steal at 79.99
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great home theater front speakers
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these plus the matching center speaker in my home theater system and i love it. They sound great and deliver crisp clean sound. Recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: LenB

customer_reviews.title: You will be impressed with the amazing sound these speakers deliver
customer_reviews.text: You will be impressed with the amazing sound these speakers deliver. Connectors in the back are really easy to set up. After installing one speaker I was pretty impressed by the quality of the sound; when installing the second one everyone loved how good the music was played by these.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Vivenes

customer_reviews.title: Best value out there!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got these on a whim instead of spendi g $800.00. Man am I pleased!! These rock!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Clear, crisp and punchy.
customer_reviews.text: Clear, crisp and punchy. They sound great. I use them in my man cave with a receiver from 1978.
customer_reviews.author: Wookiee

customer_reviews.title: Great sound at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hook up, but purchase the connecting plugs in advance.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Sooz

customer_reviews.title: Good 3-way speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is quite good despite the small size speakers. The 3-way system definitely is worth-while. So for a quick installation I recommend these speakers for their quality of sound and ability to fill a standard living room very easily.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers, should come with speaker wires
customer_reviews.text: Two gripes - - They should come with basic speaker wires as they are passive speakers and need to hooked to an AVR, etc. I had to run to BB to buy those for another $20. - Came with fingerprints on them
customer_reviews.author: Amit Parashar

product_meta.title: Sony SSCS5 3-Way 3-Driver Bookshelf Speaker System (Pair) - Black
product_meta.description: Introducing a speaker series versatile enough to deliver an unprecedented and real audio experience, and with a soundstage so expansive you can feel the energy and passion of the original performance, all while staying in harmony with your existing living spaces-no special listening room or setup required.
feature_bullets: 3-way, 3-speaker bass-reflex system, 5-1/4 inches Foamed-Mica Cellular Reinforced Woofer, 1 inch Polyester Main Tweeter
3/4 inches Sony Super Tweeter for immersive sound staging, Sound Reproduction to 50kHz (for High Resolution Audio), 6 ohm Speaker Impedance
Optimized Crossover componentry for a clear audio path, 100 W Maximum Input Power.Front Speaker Input terminal:Screw type

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars715 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
